website_summaries.verdict: The best premium pair of locking jack stands to choose when you need a more extreme, heavy-duty option.
pros: Heavy-duty construction for heavier loads of up to six tons
These stands can handle the weight of larger vehicles like heavy-duty trucks when undercarriage maintenance is required
Large area feet won't sink into asphalt
cons: Jack stands are too heavy to keep in a vehicle for on-the-road use

customer_reviews.title: Used and Wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Not only did I receive this item used but it was also the wrong model. The product info clearly states model 41202, I recieved 412002.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I am glad that I tested them out before putting them under ...
customer_reviews.text: The hinges were rusted when they arrived and the pin holding the stopper in place was rusted out in one of the jack stands . This prevented the jack stand from staying in place. I am glad that I tested them out before putting them under my car because this is very dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy no worries.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice. The constitution is far superior to those from others in the price range. Received them very quick. I have the 3 ton version they look like a kids toy next to the 12ton stands.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Heitman

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The welds had cracks and I don't want to risk anything. will return them and look for something else
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Not for modern hybrids...
customer_reviews.text: This style of jack stand is made for older vehicles. As modern vehicles, especially hybrids and electric drive, feature more underbody aerodynamic panels, these jacks are in antiquated tool. The Toyota Prius owners manual even indicates that jack stands are only to be used at the pinch weld locations near each wheel well. Using this jack stand would cause severe damage to the pinch weld, the underbody panels or the body itself. The design is lazy, do the same thing that's been done for the last hundred years. Progress has outpaced jack stand design...
customer_reviews.author: WeInSC

customer_reviews.title: Why buy local buy online!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect price for perfect item was easier buying these then going to harbor freight
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Same problem that most are having
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 6T stands. I am one to try to give the benefit of the doubt, but I have the same issue that a lot of folks here are having and that is that the supports are bent. I don't trust my vehicle or anything else to be supported by these and me be under it. I am returning these and will be ordering a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Working good so far
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve used these jack stands a few times and they’re working well. I bought the 3-ton jack stands, which is probably overdoing it for my cars, but I’d rather have more capacity and not need it, then not have more and need it. They seem well built and sturdy. These are tall, even in the fully retracted position, so I had to jack my car up pretty far just to get the stands under it, but that’s ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of jack stands. I feel very safe using these. The vehicle in the pictures is a Dodge Neon. At that lifted height I get enough room underneath the vehicle to do just about any repair. The stands can go much more higher than that but that would be necessary for holding up a small SUV or a small pick up truck, for example. I'm happy with these and would recommend to anyone. Tip: remember to use your wheel chocks always!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent quality from factory
customer_reviews.text: Like several people, I ordered these after the large Harbor Freight recall and similarly had issues with some of the heads of the stands being actually cut/welded crooked, which causes the extending stock to project at an angle and makes them less stable. I ordered two sets and both boxes had one crooked one. Thankfully, the replacement process was super easy and was able to get a single replacement set that had two quality ones in it. That quality control aspect aside, the ones that are straight seem quite sturdy and the pawls/dogs are very solid
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Did the job... barely
customer_reviews.text: These jack stands didn't come defected or damaged as others have claimed in their reviews. I was worried about that. I also got the job done of changing the struts on my car. The reason for the low review is the fear that I did have when I was working on my car. The "locking mechanism" jiggled every time pressure was applied on the car and that had me fearing for my safety. Thankfully, nothing bad happened... but these are now just gathering dust in my garage and I don't know if I will be using them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Only so-so.  Decent value but not that great
customer_reviews.text: After seeing these stands had over 4,000 reviews with about a 79% 5 star, I figured they had to be decent. I tried the amazonbasic version first but they were poor quality. These were not much better. They feel cheap and lightweight and the adjustment mechanism seems sketchy. One thing that baffles me is why jack stand manufacturers have these sharp metal legs that dig into asphalt etc. Weld a little flat plate under the legs! I ended up having to make a plate for them to sit on to prevent sinking and damaging my driveway or chipping the fleck paint off my concrete garage floor. Got to be something better out there. Ill keep looking
customer_reviews.author: MartyJoe

customer_reviews.title: Jack stand
customer_reviews.text: If the price was not through roof I would pick up other set. These pairs have held up chevy Silverado classic and trailblazer no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jashinski

customer_reviews.title: Good height range, questionable manufacturing tolerances
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 12 ton jack stands mainly for their height range. The cradles seem awfully loose in the stand for something rated for that kind of weight. I certainly wouldn't put that much weight on them and expect them to hold. I'll be keeping a close eye on them when I have half of a ~2-1/2 ton vehicle held by two of these things. It doesn't help my confidence that parts of the stand look used right out of the box. I'm pretty sure that's the effect of insufficient packaging and lots of rattling around as they made the long journey to my doorstep.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Jackstand....Great Price...BUT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing jack stands for the price. However, CHECK THE WELDS CAREFULLY!!!! I bought two packages of two jack stands each. The jack stands in package #1 were perfect. Well constructed with complete welds. The jack stands in package #2 were not properly welded. Incomplete beads and/or incomplete penetration. Ugh. They went back. The welds in the replacement package were not as good as in the first set, but acceptable. Materials were mild steel plate or castings. JUST CHECK THOSE WELDS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: bensonjon

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: These are very well built. There is a tab for you to bend in to prevent the support from pulling out of the stand. I like the way the support end has a dip in it for rubber pads if you choose to use those. I like the rubber pads and they fit perfect on the support end and it seems more secure than just metal to metal.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Feel Better/Safer putting these on my truck's frame when on drive-up Ramps
customer_reviews.text: Seem to do what they are designed to--work well, easy to adjust, received quickly and excellent value. I use these when working on my wife's car or my Nissan Frontier truck. Great for doing brake work. I feel safer using these on the frame when driving the car and truck up on ramps for oil changes. The ones I bought at Harbor Freight were recalled, and had poor welds. Seemed to be a much better value. If I was a professional mechanic, I would buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Rather Be Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Fair product for price
customer_reviews.text: They seem sturdy, and work fine. The only reason I don't give them a full 5 stars is that the bases aren't all that precise. When sitting on a flat concrete floor, one sits perfectly stable and flush, the other has a bit of wobble in it and is not fully "square" where when 3 legs are touching the floor the 4th has about a 1/8" gap before placing a load on it. That aside, once the load of my vehicle is placed on them, they are stable.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mickle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if all jack stands have a concave shape on the support, but it may have caused a bit too much weight on the elevated ends. It bent my metal undercarriage but after I bought and dded the rubber cover, there were no more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Look to be good quality but packaging is not
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs of these jack to use under my lifted Samurai. The Jack's appear to be good quality and sturdy. Not happy with the shipping packaging. The paint on all 4 Jack's was damaged and safety set screw on one of the jacks was bent on arrival. I understand they are heavy but a little extra foam would help. Paint isn't a big concern but still would be nice to have undamaged items when they first arrive.
customer_reviews.author: JMP2005

customer_reviews.title: Great quality jack stands!
customer_reviews.text: I got a outrageous deal here on Amazon on this set of Torin 2 ton jack stands. I have a set from harbor freight that are sturdy but look like factory defective products from the paint job to the knotches on the retractable part. Also the the C shaped lever on these even have a rubber end piece on each one. Details that make a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Tonyzany

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need to hold up your heavy vehicles
customer_reviews.text: These were very sturdy and stable. They are able to hold up any of my vehicles with easy, and have a good amount of adjustment for the height. They are also easy to let down when I am done. The coating is durable as well. I think it is a powder coating. The only damage to the coating is near the top where it has rubbed against the under carriage of my vehicles many times now. I would highly recommend these to anyone working on their vehicles at home.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Ton rating is combined
customer_reviews.text: Just in case anyone reads this, the rating for these, and I would say all Torin stands, are the combined ton rating. This is buried in the instruction/product manual. 2 ton stands are only 1 ton each, which makes 0 sense. I have a old pair of Snap On stands rated at 2 tons and there almost twice as heavy as these, because they are 2 tons each. So order appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: cscky

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while, but not reliable. The metal broke after a few uses, and there's no way to secure the jack in any elevated position. Luckily, it broke while i wasn't using it (just while moving it from where i was storing it to where i was going to use it).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Jack stands did a great job. I needed a pair of jack stands to hold up the dual axles on my travel trailer. These were well made and sturdy. They held up the trailer without any problems. For safety reasons, I wouldn't trust them without some backup support. I had a pile of 2x4s under the axles as backup in case the camper shifted off the jack stands. In my case, nothing shifted but I'd always have a backup just in case. Would recommend these jack stands for the right combination of price and stability.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy - great welds
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the spot-welds you see on cheaper jack stands, this is continuous beads that show quality. I trust these with my life. You can't do better for the price, and you probably shouldn't spend less on something so critical.
customer_reviews.author: H.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cars
customer_reviews.text: Good for cars. Even at max height they will be too short to get a decent lift height for most trucks and SUVs especially if you intend to be working underneath the vehicle and need the space. Even for a car I wish they were taller when Im underneath the car. Depending on what exactly you intend to use them for they can be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Santana

customer_reviews.title: Single lock insufficient
customer_reviews.text: Not a safe product imo. Single lock that requires very little up force to disengage. I jacked up the car put the new jack stands under for extra support and a tiny tap by my leg and the thing disengaged. Basically worthless for my peace of mind. Buy a double locking jack stand instead of being stupid like me
customer_reviews.author: Judy D. Hewett

customer_reviews.title: It's what you want when you're under a truck.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some jack stands for some major work I was planning on for my Tacoma. I've very pleased w/ how sturdy these stands are; I'm glad I went w/ the 6 ton and not the 3 ton. I feel more secure. I think my truck is only about 4 tons. I put a lift on my truck using these stands, and they are still long enough to handle the lifted truck. I've spent a lot of time under the truck w/ these stands. Make sure to backup w/ a jack or a tire just in case....
customer_reviews.author: Bae

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but maybe a bit fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Only used the jack stands maybe 20 times, and one just shot out some shrapnel at me once the car was lowered onto it at its lowest setting. Heard a strange noise and came around the car to see the attached pieces had come out of somewhere. Doesn’t make me confident that they’ll keep me safe!
customer_reviews.author: Tony and Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy jack stands
customer_reviews.text: I used these to hold up a 2013 Honda Civic EX-L. They felt very stable, and I had no fears crawling under the car with these jack stands in place (Civic only weighs 2900 lb). On the first use, they left an imprint on my asphalt driveway, so now I place a piece of plywood under the jacks to avoid any new imprints. I used the Seven Sparta jack pads to match the Civic jack point to the jack stand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C Swinee

customer_reviews.title: jacks had no problems supporting my full sized truck. ...
customer_reviews.text: jacks had no problems supporting my full sized truck. the only issue i had was that the pin that connects the locking lever and column arm came out when i was putting it away. i didn't notice it until i needed to use it again and saw it wasn't locking at the right height. i eventually found the pin and put it back in. now i check the pin after i use them to make sure it doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Bassist

customer_reviews.title: My husband didn't open the box until today & the ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband didn't open the box until today & the black top half wasn't in the box. The box had been opened & taped back up. Too late now to do anything about it. So he had one jack stand
customer_reviews.author: B. POND

customer_reviews.title: 4 won't support 900 pounds
customer_reviews.text: I used 4 of these to try to support a 900 pound camper. The jacks buckled and the camper went over!! I am past the return window. Any one want some buckled jacks?
customer_reviews.author: Nick Centrella

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Low quality steel results in instant bending of materials. Total safety hazard and not safe for any sized car. Avoid and purchase higher quality jack stands
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Small, not for pickups
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Not for trucks. Had to use cinder blocks in addition to these to work on my suspension on my Silverado.
customer_reviews.author: I bought one

customer_reviews.title: They're Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the smaller 3 ton to hold up the front and The 6 ton for the rear of 23' class C. You need to take the weight off the coach to preserve the expensive tires when storing longer than a couple of months. Priced right, Work great! No complaints 😉
customer_reviews.author: Elvis the King

customer_reviews.title: Was not expecting the best quality from a sub $30 set of stands
customer_reviews.text: Was not expecting the best quality from a sub $30 set of stands, but I guess its pretty hard to mess up welding a few bars together 😂 ...all jokes aside, solid set of stands for a solid price..definitely trust them to keep me from becoming one with the ground. Still not sure if "3 Ton" written on them stands for per jack or per pair... Ah well, my civic is pretty light anyways
customer_reviews.author: BodBuckets

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Sturdy build, Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these stands to support a long run of horizontal wet return boiler piping (1-1/2" diameter) . I know these jack stands are meant to support automobiles, but they support the return pipes perfectly. And I love the stands bright red paint. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin D.

customer_reviews.title: One Of The Best China Jacks
customer_reviews.text: I use it to hold up my utility trailer. It's pretty sturdy made for what it is. Remember, (in my case) its only for ONE jack, not two. Says it hold up to two tons. I'm sure that's Chinese tons so about 500 LBS.
customer_reviews.author: propflux01

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: See pictures!! Ordered this and this is the condition it came in. Clearly this product has been used before!! Also, see the picture of how it was delivered. How is this even allowed? Very disappointed on this purchase and will for sure be returning. It is completely unsafe for a product such as this one to be sold used!!
customer_reviews.author: Egrajeda

customer_reviews.title: These are for cars, not anything bigger
customer_reviews.text: Friend used these to work on a Toyota Sequoia and they got the job done. However, he found them to be a little on the short side, so just be aware if you're wanting to use these on a truck or larger SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Royappa

customer_reviews.title: Hella Great Valve You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 pairs of these jack stands for a 2008 Infiniti G35 AWD Sedan (Heavier than other variations). One of the jack stands had a crooked bottom but once I put it on a piece of board the weight of a 4000lb car corrected it. You definitely get what you pay for with these jack stands I was able to leave my car on these jack stands over night while I was changing my serpentine belt.
customer_reviews.author: Gmoney

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Great price for quality jack stands. I have had numerous Big Red products in my garage from engine lifts to jacks to jack stands and they are always top notch. Easy to use and great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and does the job , not the safest feeling
customer_reviews.text: Not the sturdiest jacks but they do the job for.light vehicle Doesn't feel like 2 ton jack at all My vehicle is around 1.3 tons supported by 4 of these on 4 points And it shakes and vo bbles a little bit when i am doing something heavy like , removing or tightening big bolts or pushing pulling on something
customer_reviews.author: Amrit

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Had my car up on these for a month while I was waiting on parts. Stayed sturdy the whole time, Even while hammering and wrenching under the vehicle, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tobin Walton

customer_reviews.title: In continuous use for three months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these because I wanted to get my 81 Jaguar XJ6 off the ground for the winter. Upon unpacking them, I can honestly report that my first impression was that these appeared to be unexpectedly high quality, especially when you consider how inexpensive they are. And, after about three months, I can tell you that that heavy, old car is still floating above the ground, being securely held by these handy jack stands.
customer_reviews.author: Mark De Mers

customer_reviews.title: Much needed support
customer_reviews.text: Keeps vehicles off of you. A second set was needed to work on an Ariens Garden tractor G17. The transmission needed service. Keeping the mower level assisted with restoring the mower back to life.
customer_reviews.author: AradoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Gambled my Life with These. I'm Still Here!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to jack my car up but I didn't have any jack stands. I figured it was worth risking my life by using these $20 jack stands. They handled the task very well. I'm glad I got these b/c my scissor jack broke and dropped the car on the ground. That could have been me under there, but not today, death.
customer_reviews.author: mesaboogie18

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set of jack stands. I feel very safe using these. The vehicle in the pictures is a Dodge Neon. At that lifted height I get enough room underneath the vehicle to do just about any repair. The stands can go much more higher than that but that would be necessary for holding up a small SUV or a small pick up truck, for example. I'm happy with these and would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Medge

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Held strong
customer_reviews.text: I needed to change the transmission fluid on a 2007 Chevy Impala as well as change a few tires. These jack stands did the trick. I felt confident enough to get underneath the car and torque a wrench without feeling like the care was going to fall on me. These felt heavy-duty which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mar Chuan

customer_reviews.title: Great jackstands. The product quality looks very high
customer_reviews.text: Great jackstands. The product quality looks very high. Would have given a perfect review but the customer is expected to complete assembly the black part of the stands need to be inserted into the red body(easy) and then bend a little retaining tab (not so easy) to keep the black parts from falling out. I bent the tabs using a vice but I imagine the process could be very difficult if you only have basic tools.
customer_reviews.author: James Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good jacks!
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Strong and sturdy. No rust after a year of sitting in the garage. I’m using it without any rubber pads, which cost $17 a pop and tend to disintegrate based on the reviews. I put it on under the chassis parts and nothing gets scratched anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Artur C.

customer_reviews.title: Probably a better buy here than auto stores.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to use for safety when I change oil on a sedan and half ton pickup at home with ramps. So I’ve never had the weight of either sitting on them but the construction seems as durable as others. Obviously, stay within the weight they’re rated for.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Ok BUT cannot be used on a lawn tractor.
customer_reviews.text: Seems solid. I bought to prop up my Sears lawn tractor BUT the manual clearly says never to use on a lawn tractor. Doesn’t say why! Thus, the true value of the jack stands falls thru the floor. I read the instructions closer: you aren’t allowed to jackstand even your RV!! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A Turner

customer_reviews.title: Durable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good stand. The reason i give 4 start is because 1 of the leg of a stand is not fully contact onto the ground. So it cause a bit unstable. However, if the vehicle weight sit onto the stand, it will become stable.
customer_reviews.author: Chany

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jacks if you buy more than 1
customer_reviews.text: *I bought 2 - (3Ton) Jack Stands (4 total) to do automotive work on my Volkswagen and they are excellent jack stands. *I've used them multiple times usually on the lowest setting because my car is so low to the ground. *They look weak, but are quite sturdy if you don't try to levitate a car on one jack. *They get 4 stars because one of the jacks is not welded properly and has to be hammered down in order to get in the correct position or be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: A little high for a Freelander 2 SUV
customer_reviews.text: Till now I used only one of these stands to keep my Land Rover LR2 SUV raised up. I chose the "6 ton" version after reading reviews saying the 3 Ton one is not so long. But for my LR2 I see it is a little higher than needed, maybe for bigger SUV's it will match more. At the end it feels of course safer when you see the 6 Ton label while underneath the car, given that you put it under the right chassis spot when it cannot slip.
customer_reviews.author: Ihab Eldeeb

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: My husband was talking about how he needed just another pair of these as he was working on his cars. When this came for Father's Day, he was so surprised and happy. He has put themn to great use. I will order 2 more sets for him for Christmas this year. Thanks for the sturdy and safe addition to our garage tools!
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE

customer_reviews.title: Trusted
customer_reviews.text: I had another set of these for years and it took every abuse that I threw at it, so when it was time to get another set why not! They have held up my full size 1/2 and 3/4 ton trucks with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We needed these jack stands to hold up my hubby's Fairlane to remove the wheels so we could replace all 4 tires. They were sturdy, stable and got the job done. Price was pretty good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaof4

customer_reviews.title: better paint job will be great
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I see this product can be improve is its paint job. 90% of the surface paint job is ok. There is some area that the paint job can be better. In time it will get scratch up here and there but I'm hoping the paint can protect the jack stand and prevent rust
customer_reviews.author: LoveToEat

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to work
customer_reviews.text: Love it and are very strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: @ebob

customer_reviews.title: uneven but the weight of a vehicle is no problem.
customer_reviews.text: not level, but works--the weight of my vehicle (2006 g35) was not a problem. i have trusted these for several jobs and they have held up its just that a product like this should be level, i have no doubt the steel is strong and that is why have put them to use but i have to say that i wouldnt buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stands.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of stands. I've used them on my 2008 Honda Civic LX several times now, and they've held the entire car up just fine (4 stands). The only thing I'd change about them is the base height. I have to jack the car up farther than I'd like to get them to be able to clear under the jack points. Not really an issue with the stands themselves, just wish they were a little smaller.
customer_reviews.author: PaddymanChris

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Jack Stands
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality jack stands, and make working under your vehicle more viable. They were easy to set up and they're easy to use. The price is really reasonable also. I like the color of them, as normal jack stands look bland while these look distinct. They hold my minivan up well, and if weighs at least two tons. These are rated up to three tons, and I'm sure they could easily handle that.
customer_reviews.author: Kam Domber

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and they work great with my Jeep. Needed these for the height more so than the 6 ton capacity...Price is right on these too. Guessing all of that is why they are so popular. They are really heavy so guessing they would hold up to some pretty big tasks
customer_reviews.author: mde8965

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stable, and cheap
customer_reviews.text: These jack stands work great for lifting holding my minivan so I can change my oil. That's about what they get used for and they are easily up to the task. I wonder if there is something you can cover the tops with to prevent scratching.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good jack stands for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good jack stands for the price. They are made of heavy steel and seem well built. I used them to hold up the front end of 11000 lb tractor. They worked well for that purpose and should hold up in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bretey

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Simple and Strong
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? These are heavy duty jack stands which are simple in design and use. You can tell from the weight and construction that they are beefy and will hold a lot of weight. I felt completely safe under my wife's SUV when it was up on 4 of these even though I was wrenching and pushing and pulling. Note that this is a set of two stands.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for doing maintenance on my 2000 Buick LeSabre. Probably could have gone with the 2-ton, but for a couple bucks more decided to get the 3-ton just to be on the safe side. These stands do exactly what they're supposed to: they hold the car up securely. The top is wide enough for the engine frame to rest on without worry. Even with me leaning against the front fender while doing/undoing bolts in the engine compartment, the car moved nary an inch. They appear to be decently built and I had no qualms about being underneath the car while it was propped up on these. For the price, these stands just can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great jack stand
customer_reviews.text: Great jack stand. Very sturdy & well-built. I have a slightly lifted 4x4 and the jack that came with the truck does the lifting part of the job but I don't have a lot of faith in it holding up the truck. This jack stand does the job.
customer_reviews.author: james coyne

customer_reviews.title: Rock&roal be ware
customer_reviews.text: Just received the 3 ton Jack stands smaller then I expected very unstable. Rocks back & forth on my drive way.ill update as soon as I use them. Not very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Solid, decent action, stable, pretty.
customer_reviews.text: Functions like any other jack stand I have ever used. Any time I've used it I have not run in to any issues. The only thing that separates it from other jack stands I have used is cosmetic. It is definitely the prettiest jack stand I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Maran Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for my boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my boat/trailer when parking at home to keep it on a solid surface. This makes it easier than keeping on the wheeled trailer jack which tends to move more. Heavyweight and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: kbrewer1113

customer_reviews.title: Great product at the right price. Needs better packaging
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 tries to get all of the parts but once I did they worked as expected and appear to be well made. If you are planning a weekend project order early and check parts as soon as you receive them. Stuff this heavy should be packaged better.
customer_reviews.author: Telos

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The packaging of this product was so-so. But it does what it's supposed to do. Torin seems to make a lot of jack-related tools. So it's obviously been in around for enough time. The jack itself isn't very tall, so it'd be good for those who have a lowered car and it'll be easier to fit underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: They'll easily hold a Jeep off the ground
customer_reviews.text: These are your basic 6 Ton jack stands. If you have an offroader then you'll want two pair. They'll easily hold a Jeep off the ground. The height is great when you need to unload the suspension. You'll still probably want to have a pair of the shorter jack stands for placing under the axles as well. I bought them when they were $25. The 'shear-pin', a bunch of people seem to mention isn't really a concern to me. I've never had any problem with this style before. These were a good value and cheap insurance.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffy

customer_reviews.title: Great design and construction.
customer_reviews.text: So far excellent quality, very sturdy and easy to use.. I’ve used it with my riding mower and it worked flawlessly.. Great design and construction
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack Stand for Home Mechanics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to jack up my 2011 Toyota Camry. I had to change the transmission fluid on it. It was perfect. Perfectly stable and secure. I felt very safe doing stuff under my car.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: This is an most have in house tools if you need to raise / work under your car
customer_reviews.text: buying my 2nd pair of stands, already got one in january it works amazing, no problem at all having the weight of a 2000 WJ Jeep Grand Cherokee V8 4x4 2" lifted, or my 2007 Mazda 6... and now i can work in the 4 wheels / corners at the same time with more safe feeling!
customer_reviews.author: XtremeFX

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Seemed very nice for the price but unfortunately they were missing the ratchet bars called company waited for return call three days before just retuning to amazon
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jandura

customer_reviews.title: ... 6 ton capacity Jack Stands and so far I'm happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I got the 6 ton capacity Jack Stands and so far I'm happy with them. They are able to hold my heavy 1/2 ton truck up with no problems. Of course I always do not rely on them 100% when i'm under my truck - so it's a good idea to add one more jack stand for insurance.
customer_reviews.author: K. Quaintance

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. A bit taller than my 1.5 ton stands but not a major problem. Solid product. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Solid and safe
customer_reviews.text: These are 6000 pound (3 ton) jack stands bought them to use on car and camper. Put the car up on both and then my husband pushed it as hard as possible and they didn't move. However because I have Sandy soil it sank so we put pavers under ours. Great job and thanks for keeping my husband safe.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for their compact size and they have worked out well. Sturdy so I feel safe work under the supported vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for old tractor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. To support rear axles on my old tractor I needed min. 18". I feel much safer using these rather than using wood blocks under my smaller car stands. They are much heavier than I need. It might be nice to have a lighter weight pair with the tall reach.
customer_reviews.author: georgeallen

customer_reviews.title: I have a jeep and these are perfect for the lifted jeep
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to add to extra to the shop, I have a jeep and these are perfect for the lifted jeep, holds without me worrying about them falling off or breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: No problem for me!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little scared to buy after reviews stated quality control issues, but not such with me. Have used these several times and they're awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: Must have when using a hydraulic jack. Ask my uncle, his hydraulic jack malfunctioned while he was under a honda civic, and without these jack stands he got trapped and was yelling for help for 45 minutes. It was hilarious becuase he didnt get hurt but learned a lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: According to my husband who loves working on cars said these work great. They are sturdy and had no problem keeping his 2018 F-150 4x4 lifted.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C - Texas City

customer_reviews.title: Good jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Defiantly a good alternative to expensive name brand jack stands that will work just as weel and are just as good of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett B.

customer_reviews.title: It holds the weight .
customer_reviews.text: My 1st time rotating tire by myself. Was worried about stands breaking. But they didn't. The only is leave a mark in the on the paint under your car. I also think they could've made the U support a little bit bigger so the tubular seats perfect know it
customer_reviews.author: Eder

customer_reviews.title: Just what the ad says
customer_reviews.text: VERY sturdy and a lot easier and faster than concrete blocks and pieces of wood which was my old system to winter store my boat and trailer.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness, functionality and look 5⭐️‘s
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Look, functionality and sturdiness gets five stars. The powder coating was impressive!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: They bowed out and became unstable under the weight of a Ford Escape, which is completely under the stated weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: I like turtles

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Did what it was supposed to do. Hold the car from falling on me. Very sturdy and trustworthy. Perfect height to change my coolant and oil in my town and country van! Whoop! Whoop! I used a sleeping mat that I take hiking to help me lay on the hot concrete without burning myself (just an FYI)..
customer_reviews.author: Drewsive

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Strong pair of jack stands. Use them to do 3 oil changes and two brakes jobs so far and has no issues. Must sure to use a punch to bend in the divet on the side of the jack stands for extra safety. Should be able to use on just about any car or suv. Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. RogersTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Yes it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to use! Great bang for your buck for your or someone else's safety. Don't skip out!
customer_reviews.author: Jerad

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used these to hold my Jeep Liberty up whole working on brakes and wheel hubs/bearings. Worked like a charm, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

product_meta.title: BIG RED T46202 Torin Steel Jack Stands: 6 Ton (12,000 lb) Capacity, Red, 1 Pair
product_meta.description: Style:1 Pair| Size:6 TonThe Torin BIG RED T46202 lightweight jack stands are used to support your vehicle after lifting with a jack. Constructed of high-grade forged steel with a welded frame design for durability, it handles a wide range of vehicles including small cars, SUVs, and light duty trucks. Adjustable height ranges from 15-3/8" to 23-13/16" with a 6 ton (12,000 lb) load capacity. Multi-position ratchet bar has a sawtooth design, allowing for quick height adjustments that lock into place. It features a large saddle surface area for better contact with the load being supported. A wide pyramid foot base provides added strength and stable support. Tested for reliability and safety to meet ASME standards. Includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Lightweight jack stands are used to support your vehicle after lifting with a jack; Wide pyramid foot base provides added strength and stable support
Adjustable height ranges from 15-3/8" to 23-13/16" with a 6 ton (12,000 lb) load capacity
Constructed of high-grade forged steel with a welded frame design for durability, it handles a wide range of vehicles including small cars, SUVs, and light duty trucks
Multi-position ratchet bar has a sawtooth design, allowing for quick height adjustments that lock into place
Features a large saddle surface area for better contact with the load being supported; Tested for reliability and safety to meet ASME standards
